metadata.name: Entry::HttpRequest
metadata.description:
Http Request

HTTP request data associated with a log entry.

metadata.name: method
metadata.description: The request method. Examples: “GET”, “HEAD”, “PUT”, “POST”.

metadata.name: method=
metadata.description: The request method. Examples: “GET”, “HEAD”, “PUT”, “POST”.

metadata.name: url
metadata.description: The scheme (http, https), the host name, the path and the query portion of the URL that was requested. Example: “http://example.com/some/info?color=red”.

metadata.name: url=
metadata.description: The scheme (http, https), the host name, the path and the query portion of the URL that was requested. Example: “http://example.com/some/info?color=red”.

metadata.name: size
metadata.description: The size of the HTTP request message in bytes, including the request headers and the request body.

metadata.name: size=
metadata.description: The size of the HTTP request message in bytes, including the request headers and the request body.

metadata.name: status
metadata.description: The response code indicating the status of response. Examples: 200, 404.

metadata.name: status=
metadata.description: The response code indicating the status of response. Examples: 200, 404.

metadata.name: response_size
metadata.description: The size of the HTTP response message sent back to the client, in bytes, including the response headers and the response body.

metadata.name: response_size=
metadata.description: The size of the HTTP response message sent back to the client, in bytes, including the response headers and the response body.

metadata.name: user_agent
metadata.description: The user agent sent by the client. Example: “Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows 98; Q312461; .NET CLR 1.0.3705)”.

metadata.name: user_agent=
metadata.description: The user agent sent by the client. Example: “Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows 98; Q312461; .NET CLR 1.0.3705)”.

metadata.name: remote_ip
metadata.description: The IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the client that issued the HTTP request. Examples: “192.168.1.1”, “FE80::0202:B3FF:FE1E:8329”.

metadata.name: remote_ip=
metadata.description: The IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the client that issued the HTTP request. Examples: “192.168.1.1”, “FE80::0202:B3FF:FE1E:8329”.

metadata.name: referer
metadata.description: The referer URL of the request, as defined in HTTP/1.1 Header Field Definitions.

metadata.name: referer=
metadata.description: The referer URL of the request, as defined in HTTP/1.1 Header Field Definitions.

metadata.name: cache_hit
metadata.description: Whether or not an entity was served from cache (with or without validation).

metadata.name: cache_hit=
metadata.description: Whether or not an entity was served from cache (with or without validation).

metadata.name: validated
metadata.description: Whether or not the response was validated with the origin server before being served from cache. This field is only meaningful if cache_hit is true.

metadata.name: validated=
metadata.description: Whether or not the response was validated with the origin server before being served from cache. This field is only meaningful if cache_hit is true.
